page.title: 01Garton-on-the-Wolds
page.content: The area surveyed lies in the parish of Garton and contains the village. The countryside lies on the southern edge of the East Yorkshire Wolds about two miles North-West of Driffield. Most of the area is occupied by south facing slopes 150' to 400' above sea-level. There is boulder clay and gravel in the south and south-west to high chalk wold land in the north. The soil and the low rainfall make the area very suitable for intensive arable farming. There is a small amount of pig, sheep and beef production. For much of the year the huge arable fields are silent apart from the drone of a distant tractor. The very quiet village of Garton contains 92 of the D-Block's 97 houses and farms. There is a fine, unusual church, a small primary school and three shops.
